meanings.definition: The range of frequencies within a given band, in particular that used for transmitting a signal.
meanings.sent1: The bandwidth of the radio waves determines how far the signal can reach.
meanings.sent2: Our internet connection has a limited bandwidth, so we can't stream HD videos smoothly.
meanings.sent3: I heard the music so clearly, it felt like the bandwidth was singing to me!
meanings.sent4: Her emotions had a bandwidth that resonated with everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bandwidth of the colors in the painting created a vibrant and dynamic effect.

meanings.definition: The amount of data that can be transmitted in a fixed amount of time.
meanings.sent1: The company upgraded its servers to increase the bandwidth for faster file transfers.
meanings.sent2: Streaming services require a high bandwidth to deliver content without buffering.
meanings.sent3: I wish my brain had more bandwidth to process all the information at once!
meanings.sent4: Her speech had a bandwidth of words that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The bandwidth of the river flow determined the speed of data transfer for the sensors placed in it.
